name.en: Literacy of digital communication and critical thinking
name.ch: 數位傳播素養與批判思考

goal.en: The design purpose of this course is to enable students to understand the impact of contemporary digital communication on processes such as the brain, thinking, human behavior, societal influences, cultural cognition, and construction. It aims to provide an understanding of how individuals, under the influence of digital technology and social media, undergo changes and development, influencing self-perception, reading behavior, social interactions, information production, and usage. The course also seeks to foster comprehension of various industries and phenomena influenced by contemporary digital technology and social media, such as marketing, content production, robots, fake news, product placement marketing, influencers, internet armies, and trending phenomena. Students will learn how to use appropriate digital tools to prevent the harm caused by misinformation, interpret facts, and conduct fact-checking. Additionally, the course will cover critical media analysis and supervision, as well as how to engage in and practice civic discussions and democratic participation, ultimately achieving the cultivation and empowerment of digital communication literacy.
goal.ch: 本課程的設計目的在於讓學生理解當代數位傳播對於大腦、思考、人類行為、社會影響、文化認知與建構的過程；理解自我在數位科技、社群媒體影響下的改變與發展，如何影響自我的認知、閱讀行為、社群交往、資訊生產與使用；理解當代數位科技與社群媒體影響下各種行銷、內容生產、機器人、假訊息、置入性行銷、網紅、網軍、帶風向等產業與現象；學習如何使用正確的數位工具防止假訊息的危害、判讀事實與進行事實查詢；學習如何批判與監督媒體；學習如何參與與實踐公民討論與民主實踐，達成數位傳播素養的培育與培力。
